channel.title: Arsenal FC News from Trinity Football
channel.description: Testing a script to generate news items related to Arsenal FC

item.title: Will Mario move to PSG? All the transfer news, rumours and gossip from Sunday's papers
item.description: PLUS: Juventus line up loan for Drogba, Liverpool ready £8m bid for Ivory Coast striker, and more...

item.title: Outside bet: Olivier Giroud wants Theo Walcott to stay out wide and deliver
item.description: The Frenchman calls Walcott his "favourite supplier" and says their partnership is getting better with every game they play together

item.title: Exit bound? Pepe Reina ready for Kop departure as Liverpool eye up Ali Al-Habsi
item.description: The Spaniard's agent has been exploring the possibility of a La Liga return - and the goalkeeper could leave Anfield in January if the price is right

item.title: Klaas apart: Man City poised to make move for Dutch master Huntelaar
item.description: The Schalke striker is free to talk from New Year's Day and Manchester City are among those interested in the 29-year-old's services

item.title: Where there's a Wil: Manchester United planning rival bid for Zaha
item.description: 'Sir Alex now thinks Zaha has the skill and bottle to play for United – and he wants him badly' says a club source

item.title: 'I like to win when Spurs are 'in control'': Wenger mocks AVB's post match comments
item.description: The Portuguese insisted his side were 'in control from the first to the last' - despite losing 5-2 to the Gunners

item.title: Bale out: Barcelona ready to concede defeat to Real Madrid in chase for Tottenham winger
item.description: The Catalans are unwilling to enter a bidding war, while Real are ready to pay £40million and give him £150,000-a-week

item.title: No returns: Fergie would love Ronaldo back at United but he's 'unbuyable'
item.description: 'Who could afford to buy him? There’s talk of the ­Russians, perhaps. But do you think he would go to Russia?' says Reds boss

item.title: Ram raid: Barcelona join City and Arsenal in chase for Derby teenager Will Hughes
item.description: Spanish greats have compiled a dossier on the 17-year-old talent after spotting him at a tournament in Portugal

item.title: No great sheikhs: City owners tell Mancini he must sell before making Falcao bid
item.description: The Italian boss is chasing the Atletico Madrid striker and Roma midfielder Danielle de Rossi

item.title: Hoop dreams: Reading line up ambitious bid for unwanted Arshavin
item.description: Russian owner Anton ­Zingarevich is ready to offer his countryman £60,000-per-week to help save them from relegation

item.title: Oscar night: Brazilian vows to shoot Chelsea through in the Champions League
item.description: 'The staff tease me, saying I only score in Europe, but I am happy with that. It would be nice to score more' says Brazilian

item.title: Andy Dunn's Big Match Verdict: Why Arsene Wenger has Emmanuel Adebayor to thank for papering over cracks
item.description: A 5-2 win provides welcome respite for Arsenal, but only came because of a brainless challenge from the red-carded former Gunner

item.title: Penny pinchers: Arsenal only offer to reward Oxlade-Chamberlain with less than Chamakh gets
item.description: Gunners are in talks over a new £45,000-a-week contract that still puts him below the likes of Squillaci and Bendtner

item.title: Full Monty: Montpellier is a 'must win' game for Arsenal, admits Aaron Ramsey
item.description: 'We are at home, so hopefully we can do that and put ­ourselves in a strong ­position to qualify' says Gunners midfielder

item.title: Glove and war: Arsenal will rival Liverpool for Wigan keeper Ali Al Habsi
item.description: Both clubs are looking to create competition for places while Wigan value the Oman international at £7million

item.title: Old pal's act: Close friendship convinced Berbatov to sign for Fulham, reveals Jol
item.description: The pair knew each other well from their time at Spurs and a call at the airport changed the striker's plans to leave for Italy

item.title: Hair apparent: Everton will turn to West Ham's Diame if Chelsea lure away Fellaini
item.description: Hammers do not want to sell the Senegal star but he has a £6million buy out clause in his contract

item.title: Norwich City 1-0 Manchester United: Anthony Pilkington's header leaves Canaries singing
item.description: The former Manchester United youth produced a remarkable glancing finish to guide Norwich to a third win of the season

item.title: Neville blow: Everton skipper out for up to eight weeks after knee surgery
item.description: The Toffees captain missed the 2-1 defeat at Reading
